name: Miso Maple-Glazed Salmon
author: Chef John
summary: This simple glaze combines salty and savory miso paste with sweet maple syrup. The rice vinegar marries the two, and a few drops of hot sauce are all you need to complete this incredibly easy, yet sophisticated dish.
ingredients: 1 teaspoon hot chili sauce (such as Sriracha®)  (Optional)
2 (6 ounce) center-cut salmon fillets, with skin
directions: Place oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler
Whisk together miso paste, seasoned rice vinegar, maple syrup, and hot chili sauce in a bowl
Brush an oven-ready skillet with vegetable oil
Place salmon fillets skin sides down in the cold skillet
Place over medium heat and cook until the skin starts to sizzle, 2 to 3 minutes
Brush each salmon fillet with miso glaze
Place skillet under the preheated broiler and cook until the salmon is just cooked through and the top is browned, about 8 minutes
Remove each fillet from the pan, separating flesh from the skin; leave the skin in the pan
